snippet: A series of emails shows that aides to Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey told officials to close lanes on the George Washington Bridge, in what appeared to be political retribution.
abstract: Series of emails shows that aides to New Jersey Gov Chris Christie ordered George Washington Bridge lane closings that turned Fort Lee, NJ, into a parking lot for four days in Sept 2013; action appears to have been political retribution toward Fort Lee Mayor Mark Sokolich after he did not endorse the governor for re-election; revelation has exploded into full-bore scandal for Christie.

byline.contributor: William K. Rashbaum and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A series of emails shows that aides to Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey told officials to close lanes on the George Washington Bridge, in what appeared to be political retribution.

headline.main: Christie Faces Scandal on Traffic Jam Aides Ordered
headline.print_headline: Christie Faces Scandal on Traffic Jam
